newsitem.title: USA: US corp debt outperforms at noon, Aikman notes off.
newsitem.headline: US corp debt outperforms at noon, Aikman notes off.

text.p: U.S. investment-grade corporate bond spreads were under pressure to tighten on the long-end as U.S. Treasuries sold off, but slow trade prevented any substantial outperformance, dealers said.
"A few of the longer issues tried to tighten a basis point or two because the market's off a half on the long end, but there's just so little trading it's hard to tell," one high-grades dealer said.
On the junk bond side, Collins & Aikman Products 11-1/2 percent notes due 2006 fell 1-1/2 to 102-1/2 on Wednesday's news it bought Foamex International's JPS Automotive unit.
Dealers said they expect virtually stagnant trade on Friday ahead of the last long U.S. weekend this summer.
The primary market was quiet with no deals priced or expected to price on Friday.
The new issue calendar will remain thin until after the U.S. employment report is released next Friday, September 6, syndicate sources said.
Other active junk bonds included Bruno's Inc 10-1/2 percent senior subordinated notes, which fell 1/4 to 101-3/4 bid, 102-1/4 offer.
Grand Union Co 12.0 percent notes lost 1/8 on bid side to 98-5/8 bid, 99-1/4 offer. Pathmark Stores Inc 9-5/8 percent notes held their own, trading unchanged at 94-5/8 bid, 95-1/4 offer.
Also, Ralphs Grocery Co 10.45 percent notes fell 1/2 to a 98-1/2 bid, 99 offer.
